description: {"blocks":[{"key":"clf63","text":"Nano-CUT\u0026Tag is a multimodal technology to profile several histone modifications at the same with single-cell resolution. Nano-CUT\u0026Tag implements a novel Tn5 fusion proteins to anti-mouse and anti-rabbit secondary nanobodies. Optionally, ATAC-seq can be performed prior on the same sample to profile open chromatin at the same time. Novel tagmentation protocol, which involves two-step tagmentation by MeA and MeB oligonucleotides yields increased number of fragments per cell comparing to previous single-cell CUT\u0026Tag protocols on 10x Genomics platform. guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vcu6","text":"This protocol involves large number of centrifugation steps, and it is critical to prevent nuclei loss and/or clumping. Therefore, always use swinging bucket rotor centrifuge for all centrifugation steps, include 2% BSA in all buffers which come in contact with nuclei and carefully aspirate the supernatant. It is better to leave cca 5-10 ul of supernatant in the tube rather than lose the nuclei. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":142,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":213,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":273,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5km6r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqmbh","text":"Clumping of nuclei can be a problematic, but generally, having cleaner nuclei helps to prevent clumping. Removing of debris from your sample is highly recommended. For mouse brain Debris Removal Solution has proven to be effective in removing excess debris (Miltenyi, 130-109-398). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cpka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63htj","text":"Some steps in this protocol involve usage of in-house produced Tn5/nano-Tn5. Individual tagmentation steps should be optimised according to specific batch of the proteins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ssph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26ud0","text":"The two-step tagmentation protocol can also be performed with pA-Tn5 protein. Load pA-Tn5 only with MeA/Me-Rev oligos and follow the protocol as described here. pA-Tn5 profiling should be compatible with ATAC-seq in the same sample, but this was not tested. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
